storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive in-app alerts for scheduling conflicts to act promptly

testCases.title: Receive in-app alert on conflict detection
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
User has active session in the application
Conflict detection engine is operational
User has appropriate permissions to view scheduling conflicts
At least two overlapping schedule entries exist in the system

steps.action: Create or modify a schedule entry that conflicts with an existing entry (e.g., assign same resource to two different tasks at overlapping times)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict automatically

steps.action: Observe the in-app notification area within 1 second of conflict creation
steps.expectedResult: In-app alert is generated and displayed prominently to the user with visual indicator (badge, popup, or notification banner)

steps.action: Click on the alert notification to view details
steps.expectedResult: Alert expands or opens to show detailed conflict information including: conflicting resources, time slots, affected schedules, and conflict type

steps.action: Review all conflict details displayed in the alert
steps.expectedResult: All relevant information is clearly visible and formatted, including resource names, dates, times, and conflict description

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' or 'Dismiss' button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is marked as acknowledged in the system and removed from the active notifications list

steps.action: Check the notification history or dismissed alerts section
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledged alert appears in the history with timestamp and acknowledgment status

postconditions: Alert is removed from active notifications
Alert acknowledgment is recorded in the system
User can access alert history if needed
Conflict remains in the system until resolved
Alert status is updated to 'Acknowledged'

testCases.title: Alert delivery performance test
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
User has active session in the application
Conflict detection engine is operational
System performance monitoring tools are available
Multiple schedule entries are available for conflict creation
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Prepare test data with 5-10 schedule entries that will create simultaneous conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Test data is ready for conflict generation

steps.action: Start performance monitoring timer or use browser developer tools to track network timing
steps.expectedResult: Performance monitoring is active and recording timestamps

steps.action: Trigger multiple conflicts simultaneously by batch updating or creating overlapping schedule entries at the same time
steps.expectedResult: System processes all conflict detections concurrently

steps.action: Observe and record the time taken for each alert to appear in the in-app notification area
steps.expectedResult: All alerts are generated and displayed to the user

steps.action: Verify the timestamp difference between conflict creation and alert display for each alert
steps.expectedResult: Each alert delivery latency is under 1 second from the moment of conflict detection

steps.action: Count the total number of alerts displayed and compare with the number of conflicts created
steps.expectedResult: 100% of conflicts generated corresponding in-app alerts (all alerts accounted for)

steps.action: Review system logs or monitoring dashboard for alert generation metrics
steps.expectedResult: System logs confirm all alerts were generated within the 1-second performance threshold

postconditions: All generated alerts are visible in the notification area
Performance metrics are recorded and meet the 1-second threshold
System remains stable after simultaneous alert generation
No alerts are lost or delayed beyond acceptable limits
Test conflicts can be cleaned up or resolved

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive email notifications for scheduling conflicts to stay informed when away

testCases.title: Receive email notification on conflict detection
preconditions: User account is configured with a valid email address
Email notification preferences are enabled for the user
SMTP or email service is properly configured and operational
Conflict detection engine is operational
User has appropriate permissions to receive conflict notifications
Test email inbox is accessible for verification

steps.action: Create or modify a schedule entry that creates a scheduling conflict (e.g., double-booking a resource or overlapping time slots)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict automatically through the conflict detection engine

steps.action: Wait and monitor for email notification generation (should occur within 5 seconds)
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is generated by the system and sent to the configured email address

steps.action: Check the user's email inbox for the conflict notification email
steps.expectedResult: User receives the email notification in their inbox within 5 seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Open and review the email content
steps.expectedResult: Email contains detailed conflict information including: subject line indicating conflict, conflicting resource names, date and time of conflict, affected schedules, conflict type, and clear description of the issue

steps.action: Review suggested actions or links provided in the email
steps.expectedResult: Email includes suggested actions such as links to resolve conflict, view schedule details, or contact relevant parties

steps.action: Click on any action links provided in the email (e.g., 'View Conflict' or 'Resolve Now')
steps.expectedResult: Links direct user to the appropriate section of the application where they can take action to resolve the conflict

steps.action: Verify email formatting and readability across different email clients if possible
steps.expectedResult: Email is properly formatted, professional, and readable with all information clearly presented

postconditions: Email notification is successfully delivered to user's inbox
Email delivery status is tracked in the system
User is informed about the conflict and can take appropriate action
Email remains in inbox for future reference
System logs record successful email delivery

testCases.title: Email delivery performance test
preconditions: User account is configured with a valid email address
Email notification preferences are enabled
SMTP or email service is properly configured and operational
Conflict detection engine is operational
Email delivery tracking system is enabled
System performance monitoring tools are available
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Prepare test environment and note the current timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Test environment is ready and baseline timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Start performance monitoring to track email delivery timing
steps.expectedResult: Performance monitoring is active and ready to capture metrics

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict by creating or modifying a schedule entry that conflicts with an existing entry
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and initiates email notification process

steps.action: Record the exact timestamp when the conflict was created/detected
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection timestamp is captured for performance calculation

steps.action: Monitor the email service logs or system logs for email send confirmation
steps.expectedResult: System logs show email was queued and sent to the email service provider

steps.action: Check the email inbox and record the timestamp when the email is received
steps.expectedResult: Email appears in the inbox and receipt timestamp is captured

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between conflict detection and email receipt
steps.expectedResult: Email delivery time is within 5 seconds of conflict detection as per performance requirement

steps.action: Review system logs and email delivery tracking dashboard for delivery status
steps.expectedResult: System confirms successful delivery with status 'Delivered' and timestamp within 5-second threshold

steps.action: Verify no email bounces or delivery failures occurred
steps.expectedResult: Email delivery status shows successful delivery with no bounce or error messages

postconditions: Email is successfully delivered within 5 seconds
Email delivery metrics are recorded in the system
Performance requirement is validated and met
Email delivery status is tracked and shows 'Delivered'
No bounces or delivery failures are recorded
System remains stable after email delivery

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view detailed conflict information to understand and resolve scheduling issues

testCases.title: View detailed conflict information
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler with valid credentials
At least one scheduling conflict exists in the system
User has appropriate access permissions to view conflict data
Conflict detection engine has identified and flagged conflicts
Network connection is stable

steps.action: User receives a conflict alert notification and clicks on it to open conflict details
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details view opens and loads completely within 2 seconds, displaying a loading indicator during the fetch process

steps.action: User reviews the displayed conflict information including event names, dates, times, and descriptions
steps.expectedResult: All conflicting event details are displayed clearly with proper formatting, including event titles, scheduled times, and event descriptions

steps.action: User reviews the resource allocation information shown in the conflict details
steps.expectedResult: All conflicting resources are listed with their current assignments, availability status, and resource types clearly visible

steps.action: User reviews the participant information for all conflicting events
steps.expectedResult: Complete list of participants involved in the conflict is displayed with their names, roles, and availability status

steps.action: User examines the suggested resolution options provided by the system
steps.expectedResult: System displays multiple resolution suggestions such as time adjustments, resource alternatives, or participant reassignments with clear descriptions

steps.action: User clicks on the navigation link to view the first conflicting event
steps.expectedResult: User is redirected to the event scheduling page for the selected conflicting event, with all event details loaded and editable

steps.action: User navigates back to conflict details and clicks on the second conflicting event link
steps.expectedResult: User is taken to the event scheduling page for the second conflicting event, maintaining context of the conflict resolution workflow

postconditions: User has viewed complete conflict information
User is positioned on the event scheduling page of the last viewed conflicting event
Conflict remains in unresolved state until user takes action
Navigation history includes conflict details view and visited event pages
System logs the conflict view activity for audit purposes
